definition: to lay bare/to come to light
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: His wild ambition was thoroughly exposed.
sentences.chinese: 他的狼子野心暴露無遺。
你的詭計已暴露無遺了。

sentences.english: Do you chat with people in the hallways and reveal your own weaknesses to them?
sentences.chinese: 你會在走廊與人閒聊，還把自己的弱點都暴露無遺嗎？

sentences.english: Cheng hai ambitions are exposed, millions of heroes list but is a conspiracy.
sentences.chinese: 程海的野心暴露無遺，百萬英雄榜不過是一場陰謀。

sentences.english: Second, write it down, to externalize it.
sentences.chinese: 第二，把它記下來，讓它暴露無遺。

sentences.english: His eyes gave him away, shining with cupidity.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼裏閃着貪婪的光芒，使他暴露無遺。

sentences.english: The solidification and larkishness of those moments exposed my conflict and anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 那些瞬間的凝固與嬉戲，將我的牴觸與不安暴露無遺。
